chinese: 你得设身处地为我想想 (Nǐ děi shèshēnchǔdì wèi wǒ xiǎngxiang) / 你站我角度看看 (Nǐ zhàn wǒ jiǎodù kànkan)
spanish: Ponte en mis zapatos. / Ponte en mi lugar.

example:
A: Yo, where have you been?
B: Just busy with life, you know.
A: Haven't seen you at the spot.
B: Yeah, I've been low key.
A: Well, glad you're back.
B: Same.
japanese: どこ行ってたの？／久（ひさ）しぶりだね
chinese: 你死哪儿去了？ (Nǐ sǐ nǎr qù le?) / 好久不见，去哪了？ (Hǎojiǔ bújiàn, qù nǎ le?)
spanish: ¿Dónde te habías metido? / ¿Dónde has estado?

example:
A: I'm moving out tomorrow.
B: Dang, don't be a stranger.
A: Of course not, I'll call.
B: Better see you around.
A: For sure, take care.
B: You too.
japanese: 連絡（れんらく）してね／また会（あ）おうね
chinese: 别不联系啊 (Bié bù liánxì a) / 常联系 (Cháng liánxì)
spanish: No te pierdas. / Mantente en contacto.

example:
A: Can I return this later?
B: Sorry, all sales are final.
A: Even if it's broken?
B: Check it before you buy.
A: Harsh rules.
B: Store policy, man.
japanese: 返品（へんぴん）不可（ふか）です／交換（こうかん）できません
chinese: 售出不退 (Shòuchū bú tuì) / 离柜概不负责 (Lí guì gàibùfùzé)
spanish: No se aceptan devoluciones. / Las ventas son finales.

example:
A: You spilled my drink!
B: I never meant to, my bad.
A: It's all over my shoes.
B: I'll get some napkins.
A: Hurry up, please.
B: On it.
japanese: わざとじゃないんだ／そんなつもりじゃなかった
chinese: 我不是故意的 (Wǒ búshì gùyì de) / 我没那个意思 (Wǒ méi nàge yìsi)
spanish: No fue mi intención. / No quise hacerlo.

example:
A: So how do we split the rent?
B: Here's the deal, I pay 60, you pay 40.
A: Why do the math like that?
B: I got the bigger room, facts.
A: Fair enough, I'm down.
B: Bet, let's sign it.
japanese: こうしよう／条件（じょうけん）はこうだ
chinese: 情况是这样的 (Qíngkuàng shì zhèyàng de) / 咱们这么着 (Zánmen zhème zhe)
spanish: El trato es este. / Así está la cosa.

example:
A: And then he said that his dog...
B: Yo, enough chit chat. We gotta work.
A: My bad, just a quick story.
B: We're on a deadline, focus up.
A: Copy that, back to the code.
B: Good lookin'.
japanese: 無駄話（むだばなし）はここまで／おしゃべりは終（お）わり
chinese: 闲话少说 (Xiánhuà shǎoshuō) / 言归正传 (Yánguīzhèngzhuàn)
spanish: Basta de charla. / Menos plática y más acción.

example:
A: The project is due in an hour.
B: We can pull this off, trust me.
A: You really think so?
B: We just gotta grind it out.
A: Let's get it then.
B: Full steam ahead.
japanese: うまくいくよ／なんとかなるよ
chinese: 我们可以搞定的 (Wǒmen kěyǐ gǎodìng de) / 这事能成 (Zhè shì néng chéng)
spanish: Podemos lograrlo. / Podemos sacar esto adelante.

example:
A: You're gonna pay me back, right?
B: You have my word, next Friday.
A: Better not be ghosting me.
B: No cap, I got you.
A: Alright, I'll hold you to it.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 約束（やくそく）する／誓（ちか）うよ
chinese: 我向你保证 (Wǒ xiàng nǐ bǎozhèng) / 我说话算话 (Wǒ shuōhuà suànhuà)
spanish: Te doy mi palabra. / Te lo prometo.

example:
A: Can I just add one more thing?
B: Sorry, time's up.
A: Just a second!
B: Rule is a rule, man.
A: Dang, I was so close.
B: Maybe next time.
japanese: 時間（じかん）切（ぎ）れ／そこまで
chinese: 时间到 (Shíjiān dào) / 没时间了 (Méi shíjiān le)
spanish: Se acabó el tiempo. / Tiempo fuera.

primary: Do I know you from somewhere?
example:
A: Do I know you from somewhere?
B: Maybe at that party last week?
A: Ah, that's it! In the Bronx.
B: Yeah, I was by the DJ booth.
A: Crazy coincidence.
B: For real though.
japanese: どこかでお会（あ）いしましたっけ？／知（し）り合（あ）いでしたっけ？
chinese: 我看你很面熟 (Wǒ kàn nǐ hěn miànshú) / 我们是不是在哪儿见过？ (Wǒmen shìbushì zài nǎr jiànguo?)
spanish: Es pan comido. / Está facilísimo.

primary: Fake it till you make it.
example:
A: I'm nervous about the presentation.
B: Just fake it till you make it, man.
A: What if they see through me?
B: Confidence is key, just vibe.
A: Alright, I'll try my best.
B: You got this, no cap.
japanese: できるフリしてればなんとかなる／ハッタリも実力（じつりょく）のうち
chinese: 装也要装得像一点 (Zhuāng yě yào zhuāng de xiàng yìdiǎn) / 先假装行，最后就真行了 (Xiān jiǎzhuāng xíng, zuìhòu jiù zhēn xíng le)
spanish: Me quedé en blanco. / Se me fue la onda.

example:
A: Why didn't I get the promotion?
B: Don't take it personally, it was budget.
A: Still feels bad though.
B: I get it, but your time is coming.
A: Thanks for the talk.
B: Anytime, keep grinding.
japanese: 悪気（わるぎ）はないんだ／気（き）にしないで
chinese: 别往心里去 (Bié wǎng xīnli qù) / 别太在意 (Bié tài zàiyì)
spanish: Te debo una. / Estoy en deuda contigo.

example:
A: Why is the subway always late?
B: That's the way it is in NYC.
A: It's so frustrating though.
B: You get used to it, eventually.
A: I guess so.
B: Facts.
japanese: そういうものだよ／仕方（しかた）ないよ
chinese: 现实就是这样 (Xiànshí jiùshì zhèyàng) / 命就这样 (Mìng jiù zhèyàng)
spanish: No me cuadra. / Algo no encaja.

example:
A: I think I can jump that gap.
B: Don't be ridiculous, you'll fall.
A: I'm fast though!
B: Not that fast, stay safe.
A: Fine, I'll walk around.
B: Smart move.
japanese: バカなこと言（い）わないで／ふざけないで
chinese: 别犯傻了 (Bié fànshǎ le) / 别荒唐了 (Bié huāngtáng le)
spanish: Vamos a medias. / Pagamos mitad y mitad.

example:
A: Why so sad, man?
B: I got dumped last night.
A: No way, what happened?
B: She said it just wasn't working.
A: Tough break, let's grab a drink.
B: I need it, for real.
japanese: 振（ふ）られた／彼女（かのじょ）に捨（す）てられた
chinese: 我被甩了 (Wǒ bèi shuǎi le) / 我失恋了 (Wǒ shīliàn le)
spanish: Me estás tomando el pelo. / Me estás bromeando.

example:
A: He didn't come because he was sick.
B: Ah, now it makes sense.
A: Yeah, he was feeling rough.
B: Well, I hope he gets better.
A: Same here.
B: No doubt.
japanese: それで納得（なっとく）／合点（がてん）がいった
chinese: 这下说得通了 (Zhèxià shuōdetōng le) / 原来如此 (Yuánláirúcǐ)
spanish: Mantén la cabeza en alto. / No te desanimes.

example:
A: Are you ready for the meeting?
B: Let's get it over with, honestly.
A: Nervous?
B: Just want to be done.
A: I feel you, let's go.
B: Bet.
japanese: さっさと済（す）ませよう／早（はや）く終わらせよう
chinese: 速战速决吧 (Sùzhànsùjué ba) / 赶紧完事吧 (Gǎnjǐn wánshì ba)
spanish: Es ahora o nunca. / No hay otra oportunidad.

example:
A: The concert got rained out.
B: What a shame, I was hyped.
A: Me too, bought the outfit and all.
B: Hopefully they reschedule.
A: Better be soon.
B: For real.
japanese: 残念（ざんねん）だね／もったいないね
chinese: 真遗憾 (Zhēn yíhàn) / 太可惜了 (Tài kěxī le)
spanish: Déjalo ya. / Olvídalo.

example:
A: She keeps texting me every hour.
B: Bro, she's obsessed with you.
A: It's starting to get creepy.
B: You gotta set some boundaries.
A: Facts, I will today.
B: Good luck with that.
japanese: 君（きみ）に夢中（むちゅう）だね／君（きみ）しか見（み）えてないね
chinese: 她迷上你了 (Tā míshàng nǐ le) / 她对你着魔了 (Tā duì nǐ zháomó le)
spanish: Estoy harto. / Ya me cansé.

example:
A: So the plan is to link at 9.
B: Wait, what about the car?
A: Are you with me? I said take the bus.
B: Oh, my bad. I'm on it now.
A: Focus up, we're moving.
B: Bet.
japanese: 聞（き）いてる？／理解（りかい）できた？
chinese: 你听懂了吗？ (Nǐ tīngdǒng le ma?) / 这个能理解吗？ (Zhège néng lǐjiě ma?)
spanish: No tiene sentido. / Es ilógico.

example:
A: Why are you being so loud?
B: Mind your business, man.
A: Just asking, relax.
B: Well, keep your head out of it.
A: Alright, chill.
B: Good.
japanese: 余計（よけい）なお世話（せわ）だ／関係（かんけい）ないでしょ
chinese: 少管闲事 (Shǎo guǎn xiánshì) / 没你事儿 (Méi nǐ shìr)
spanish: Piénsalo bien. / Medítalo antes de actuar.

example:
A: You were really mad earlier.
B: Yeah, I overreacted. Sorry about that.
A: All good, we all have those days.
B: I was just stressed, no cap.
A: Reset and vibe on.
B: For sure.
japanese: 大（おお）げさだった／取（と）り乱（みだ）しちゃった
chinese: 我反应过激了 (Wǒ fǎnyìng guòjī le) / 我太激动了 (Wǒ tài jīdòng le)
spanish: Es un secreto a voces. / Todo el mundo lo sabe.

primary: I have nothing to do with that.
example:
A: Did you tell her about the secret?
B: I have nothing to do with that.
A: Then who did?
B: Probably Sam, he's always talking.
A: I'll check with him then.
B: Do that, keep me out.
japanese: 私（わたし）には関係（かんけい）ない／知（し）ったことじゃない
chinese: 这跟我没关系 (Zhè gēn wǒ méi guāxì) / 我跟这事儿不沾边 (Wǒ gēn zhè shìr bù zhānbiān)
spanish: No me malinterpretes. / No me tomes a mal.

example:
A: Wanna hit the club tonight?
B: I think I'll pass, I'm tired.
A: Come on, it'll be lit!
B: Nah, I need my 8 hours.
A: Your loss, see ya.
B: Have fun, peace.
japanese: やめとくよ／パスするよ
chinese: 我还是算了吧 (Wǒ háishì suànle ba) / 我就不参与了 (Wǒ jiù bù cānyù le)
spanish: Estoy sin blanca. / No tengo ni un quinto.

example:
A: Why is my bill so high?
B: There's been a big mistake, let me check.
A: Better fix it quick.
B: Appears we overcharged you, sorry.
A: Appreciate the fast catch.
B: No worries, fixed now.
japanese: 大（だい）失敗（しっぱい）だった／間違（まちが）いだった
chinese: 搞错了 (Gǎo cuò le) / 出了个大乌龙 (Chū le gè dà wūlóng)
spanish: A otro perro con ese hueso. / No te creo nada.

example:
A: You look stressed, you okay?
B: I gotta get some air, honestly.
A: Want me to come with?
B: Nah, I just need a minute alone.
A: Cool, take your time.
B: Thanks.
japanese: 外（そと）の空気（くうき）吸（す）ってくる／頭（あたま）冷（ひ）やしてくる
chinese: 我得透透气 (Wǒ děi tòutouqì) / 我出去吸口氧 (Wǒ chūqù xī kǒu yǎng)
spanish: Más claro, ni el agua. / Está clarísimo.

primary: Okay if we take a rain check?
example:
A: Still on for dinner?
B: Okay if we take a rain check? Something came up.
A: Sure, another time then.
B: Appreciate you being chill about it.
A: No sweat, catch you later.
B: Bet.
japanese: また今度（こんど）でもいい？／延期（えんき）してもいい？
chinese: 改天行吗？ (Gǎitiān xíng ma?) / 下次吧好吗？ (Xiàcì ba hǎoma?)
spanish: Se me pegaron las sábanas. / Me quedé dormido.

example:
A: He said he'd call me back.
B: Don't hold your breath, he's flakier than a croissant.
A: That's harsh.
B: Just keeping it real with you.
A: I'll try not to worry then.
B: Smart move.
japanese: 期待（きたい）しない方（ほう）がいいよ／当（あ）てにしない方がいい
chinese: 别抱太大希望 (Bié bào tài dà xīwàng) / 别指望了 (Bié zhǐwàng le)
spanish: Me importa un bledo. / Me da igual.

similar: I don't know him like that.
example:
A: Are you both together?
B: Nah, he's not with me.
A: Oh, sorry. Thought you were friends.
B: Easy mistake, no worries.
A: Have a good one.
B: You too.
japanese: 連（つ）れじゃないです／関係（かんけい）ない人（ひと）です
chinese: 他不跟我一起 (Tā bù gēn wǒ yìqǐ) / 我跟他不是一伙的 (Wǒ gēn tā búshì yìhuǒ de)
spanish: No hay mal que por bien no venga. / Todo pasa por algo.

example:
A: What's wrong now?
B: First my phone, now my car. I can't catch a break.
A: That's tough, man.
B: Tells me the universe is buggin'.
A: Take a breather, it'll pass.
B: Hope so.
japanese: 全然（ぜんぜん）ついてない／踏（ふ）んだり蹴（け）ったりだ
chinese: 我最近太背了 (Wǒ zuìjìn tài bèi le) / 倒霉事都赶一起了 (Dǎoméi shì dōu gǎn yìqǐ le)
spanish: Tirar la toalla. / Rindirse.

example:
A: Yo, do me a favor and watch my bag?
B: Sure, for how long?
A: Just five minutes, gotta hit the restroom.
B: I got you, no worries.
A: Appreciate the solid.
B: Bet.
japanese: お願（ねが）いがあるんだけど／手（て）を貸（か）して
chinese: 帮我个忙 (Bāng wǒ gè máng) / 搭把手 (Dā bǎ shǒu)
spanish: Hacer de tripas corazón. / Sacar fuerzas de flaqueza.

example:
A: They actually broke up.
B: I knew it, they were arguing all week.
A: Sad though, they were cute.
B: Sometimes it's for the best.
A: True that.
B: No cap.
japanese: やっぱりね／そう来（く）ると思（おも）った
chinese: 我就知道 (Wǒ jiù zhīdào) / 果然不出我所料 (Guǒrán bù chū wǒ suǒliào)
spanish: Empezar con el pie derecho. / Empezar bien.

similar: My bad, forget I said it.
example:
A: You said I was lazy!
B: Fine, I take it back. You're working hard.
A: Thanks, finally some credit.
B: I was just frustrated earlier.
A: Accepted apology.
B: Word.
japanese: 取（と）り消（け）すよ／今のなし
chinese: 我收回那句话 (Wǒ shōuhuí nà jù huà) / 当我没说 (Dāng wǒ méi shuō)
spanish: Costar un ojo de la cara. / Ser carísimo.

example:
A & B: Pizza tonight!
A: Jinx! You owe me a soda.
B: No way, we said it together!
A: Rule of the game, pay up.
B: Fine, I'll get the drinks.
A: Victory!
japanese: ハモった！／かぶった！
chinese: 心有灵犀！ (Xīnyǒulíngxī!) / 咱俩想到一块去了！ (Zánliǎ xiǎngdào yíkuài qù le!) (Also: Jinx = 乌鸦嘴 wūyāzuǐ if modifying bad luck, but here it's 'simultaneous speech game')
spanish: Estar en las nubes. / Estar distraído.

example:
A: Does money make you happy?
B: Not necessarily, peace of mind is bigger.
A: Good point, some rich folks are sad.
B: Exactly, vibes matter most.
A: Facts.
B: Straight up.
japanese: 必（かなら）ずしもそうじゃない／そうとは限（かぎ）らない
chinese: 那倒未必 (Nà dào wèibì) / 不见得 (Bújiànde)
spanish: Dar en el blanco. / Acertar.

example:
A: Is the dinner ready yet?
B: Ta-da! Freshly made pasta.
A: Wow, looks amazing!
B: Dig in while it's hot.
A: You really outdid yourself.
B: Enjoy, my friend.
japanese: ジャジャーン！／完成（かんせい）！
chinese: 当当当当！ (Dāngdāngdāngdāng!) / 看这里！ (Kàn zhèlǐ!)
spanish: Ser pan comido. / Ser muy fácil.

example:
A: I think we should focus on marketing.
B: We're on the same page, I was just saying that.
A: Great, let's start the campaign then.
B: No doubt, let's get it.
A: Solid plan.
B: Bet.
japanese: 意見（いけん）が一致（いっち）してるね／同感（どうかん）だよ
chinese: 我们想到一块儿去了 (Wǒmen xiǎngdào yíkuàir qù le) / 自解是一致的 (Zìjiě shì yízhì de)
spanish: Tomar el toro por los cuernos. / Afrontar el problema.

example:
A: Should we hire him?
B: I like his portfolio. What do you say?
A: I'm down if you are.
B: Let's give him a shot then.
A: Sounds good to me.
B: Great.
japanese: どう？／どう思（おも）う？
chinese: 你怎么看？ (Nǐ zěnme kàn?) / 你觉得呢？ (Nǐ juéde ne?)
spanish: Estar entre la espada y la pared. / Estar en un dilema.

primary: I warned you this would happen.
meaning: 이런 일이 일어날 거라고 내가 경고 했잖아.
example:
A: My phone broke after dropping it in the lake.
B: I warned you this would happen, man.
A: I thought it was waterproof!
B: Clearly not. Now you need a new one.
A: My wallet is crying.
B: Lessons learned.
japanese: 言（い）った通りでしょ／だから言（い）ったのに
chinese: 我早告诉过你会这样的 (Wǒ zǎo gàosu guò nǐ huì zhèyàng de) / 我早就警告过你 (Wǒ zǎojiù jǐnggào guò nǐ)
spanish: Darle la vuelta a la tortilla. / Cambiar la situación.

example:
A: Still mad about the argument?
B: Nah, it's water under the bridge now.
A: Glad to hear that, I felt bad.
B: No worries, we're good.
A: Awesome.
B: Vibes.
japanese: 済（す）んだことだよ／昔（むかし）の話（はなし）だよ
chinese: 都过去了 (Dōu guòqù le) / 往事别再提了 (Wǎngshì bié zài tí le)
spanish: No todo lo que brilla es oro. / Las apariencias engañan.

example:
A: How much will the renovation cost?
B: I have a ballpark figure, around 5k.
A: Is that including materials?
B: Yeah, give or take a few.
A: Alright, good to know.
B: No prob.
japanese: ざっくりした数字（すうじ）／概算（がいさん）
chinese: 我有个大概的数 (Wǒ yǒu gè dàgài de shù) / 心里有个底 (Xīnli yǒu gè dǐ)
spanish: Matar dos pájaros de un tiro. / Hacer dos cosas a la vez.

example:
A: I messed up the presentation.
B: Don't beat yourself up, you'll nail it next time.
A: I just feel so stupid.
B: Everyone slips up, just keep pushing.
A: Thanks for the pep talk.
B: Anytime.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）を責（せ）めないで／落（お）ち込（こ）まないで
chinese: 别自责了 (Bié zìzé le) / 别跟自己过不去 (Bié gēn zìjǐ guòbùqù)
spanish: Más vale tarde que nunca. / Mejor tarde.

example:
A: Why'd you guys break up?
B: He cheated on me with his ex.
A: No way, that's low.
B: I deserve better, honestly.
A: 100%, you're a queen.
B: Thanks for the support.
japanese: 浮気（うわき）された／裏切（うらぎ）られた
chinese: 他劈腿了 (Tā pītuǐ le) / 他出轨了 (Tā chūguǐ le)
spanish: En boca cerrada no entran moscas. / Mejor quedarse callado.

example:
A: Did you finish the report?
B: No, and the meeting is in five minutes. I'm so screwed.
A: Want me to help you stall?
B: Please, that would be a lifesaver.
A: Leave it to me.
B: You're the best.
japanese: 最悪（さいあく）だ／終（お）わった
chinese: 我死定了 (Wǒ sǐdìng le) / 我完蛋了 (Wǒ wándàn le)
spanish: Camarón que se duerme se lo lleva la corriente. / Si te descuidas, pierdes.

example:
A: My life is over because of this pimple!
B: Yo, you're being so dramatic.
A: But it's huge!
B: Nobody even noticed until you said something.
A: Fine, maybe I'm overreacting.
B: Facts.
japanese: 大（おお）げさだよ／悲劇（ひげき）のヒロインぶらないで
chinese: 你也太戏精了 (Nǐ yě tài xìjīng le) / 别那么夸张 (Bié nàme kuāzhāng)
spanish: A caballo regalado no se le mira el diente. / Acepta los regalos sin quejarte.

example:
A: I think I can beat the pro at chess.
B: Trust me, you're out of your league.
A: I've been practicing though!
B: He's a grandmaster, man. Relax.
A: Fair point.
B: Stick to the amateurs.
japanese: 高嶺（たかね）の花（はな）だよ／相手（あいて）にされないよ／レベルが違（ちが）う
chinese: 你高攀不起 (Nǐ gāopānbùqǐ) / 这不是你能驾驭的 (Zhè búshì nǐ néng jiàyù de)
spanish: Quien mucho abarca poco aprieta. / No trates de hacer todo a la vez.

example:
A: The test results came back negative.
B: Oh man, I'm so relieved.
A: Me too, I was worried sick.
B: Thanks for being there with me.
A: Always, no doubt.
B: Let's celebrate.
japanese: 安心（あんしん）した／ホッとした
chinese: 我总算放心了 (Wǒ zǒngsuàn fàngxīn le) / 心里石头落地了 (Xīnli shítou luòdì le)
spanish: Dime con quién andas y te diré quién eres. / Las compañías definen quién eres.

example:
A: Do you think Mark likes me?
B: Girl, he's crazy about you.
A: Really? He's so shy though.
B: Have you seen how he looks at you? No cap.
A: Maybe I should talk to him.
B: Do it, he's waiting.
japanese: 君（きみ）に首（くび）ったけだね／ゾッコンだね
chinese: 他对你着迷了 (Tā duì nǐ zháomí le) / 他超级喜欢你 (Tā chāojí xǐhuan nǐ)
spanish: Ojos que no ven, corazón que no siente. / Si no lo veo, no me duele.

example:
A: Yo, how are we on time?
B: We've got about ten minutes left.
A: Perfect, enough to finish this up.
B: Hurry though, don't slack.
A: On it, for real.
B: Bet.
japanese: 時間（じかん）どう？／遅（おく）れてない？
chinese: 时间来得及吗？ (Shíjiān láidejí ma?) / 我们赶趟吗？ (Wǒmen gǎntàng ma?)
spanish: Perro que ladra no muerde. / Mucho ruido y pocas nueces.

primary: Don't try to butter me up.
similar: No need for the sweet talk.
example:
A: You look so fit today! Did you hit the gym?
B: Don't try to butter me up. What do you want?
A: Can I borrow twenty bucks?
B: I knew it was coming! Nope.
A: Worth a shot though.
B: Nice try.
japanese: お世辞（せじ）はいいよ／ゴマすらないで
chinese: 别拍马屁 (Bié pāimǎpì) / 少来这套 (Shǎo lái zhè tào)
spanish: El que ríe al último, ríe mejor. / La victoria final es la que cuenta.

primary: I do have feelings for you.
similar: Got a soft spot for you.
example:
A: I wasn't sure if you felt the same way.
B: I do have feelings for you, honestly.
A: Really? I'm so happy to hear that.
B: Just didn't know how to say it.
A: Glad you did now.
B: Me too, no cap.
japanese: 気（き）があるんだ／好（す）きなんだ
chinese: 我对你是有感觉的 (Wǒ duì nǐ shì yǒu gǎnjué de) / 我确实喜欢你 (Wǒ quèshí xǐhuan nǐ)
spanish: Hierba mala nunca muere. / Los malos siempre duran.

example:
A: I'll be there in like five minutes.
B: Don't keep me waiting, I'm already here.
A: Just grabbing my keys now.
B: Be quick if you want to catch the show.
A: On my way!
B: Better be.
japanese: 待（ま）たせないで／早（はや）くして
chinese: 别让我久等 (Bié ràng wǒ jiǔděng) / 快点儿 (Kuàidiǎnr)
spanish: Al mal tiempo, buena cara. / Sé positivo ante los problemas.

primary: You guys are so made for each other.
example:
A: I think we're going to get married.
B: You guys are so made for each other, honestly.
A: Thanks, it feels right.
B: Everyone sees it, no cap.
A: Appreciate the love.
B: Always.
japanese: お似合（にあ）いだね／ベストカップルだね
chinese: 你们俩太般配了 (Nǐmen liǎ tài bānpèi le) / 天生一对 (Tiānshēng yí duì)
spanish: No hay peor sordo que el que no quiere oír. / Es inútil hablar con quien no quiere escuchar.

example:
A: I'm not going to the party after all.
B: Suit yourself, but you're missing out.
A: I just need some alone time.
B: All good, enjoy the peace.
A: See ya tomorrow.
B: Peace.
japanese: 勝手（かって）にすれば／好（す）きにすれば
chinese: 随你便 (Suí nǐ biàn) / 爱咋咋地 (Ài zǎzǎdì)
spanish: Cría cuervos y te sacarán los ojos. / La ingratitud duele.

example:
A: Should I add more salt?
B: Nah, that should do it.
A: You sure? I want it fire.
B: Trust me, it's perfect now.
A: Alright, serving it up.
B: Let's eat!
japanese: これで十分（じゅうぶん）／これでOK
chinese: 这样就行了 (Zhèyàng jiù xíng le) / 差不多了 (Chàbuduō le)
spanish: Del dicho al hecho hay mucho trecho. / Decir es fácil, hacer es difícil.

similar: Be back in a sec, freshening up.
example:
A: Dinner is in twenty minutes.
B: Perfect, I'm gonna go freshen up.
A: Take your time, don't rush.
B: Be back out in ten.
A: Alright, cool.
B: Bet.
japanese: リフレッシュしてくる／化粧（けしょう）直（なお）してくる／シャワー浴（あ）びてくる
chinese: 我去洗漱一下 (Wǒ qù xǐshù yíxià) / 我去补个妆 (Wǒ qù bǔ gè zhuāng)
spanish: El hábito no hace al monje. / La ropa no define a la persona.

example:
A: How do I look in this shirt?
B: Uh, you're wearing it backwards.
A: No way! Are you serious?
B: Yeah, the tag is right there on your neck.
A: Oh shoot, my bad.
B: Hilarious, honestly.
japanese: 後（うし）ろ前（まえ）だよ／反対（はんたい）だよ
chinese: 你穿反了 (Nǐ chuān fǎn le) (inside out/backwards generic) / 前后穿反了 (Qiánhòu chuān fǎn le)
spanish: Aunque la mona se vista de seda, mona se queda. / No se puede ocultar lo que uno es.

primary: Will you be home for dinner?
example:
A: Will you be home for dinner?
B: Yeah, I'll be back around 7.
A: Great, I'm making lasagna.
B: Fire! Can't wait.
A: See you then.
B: Bet.
japanese: 夕飯（ゆうはん）家（いえ）で食（た）べる？／ご飯（はん）どうする？
chinese: 你回家吃晚饭吗？ (Nǐ huíjiā chī wǎnfàn ma?) / 晚上回来吃吗？ (Wǎnshang huílái chī ma?)
spanish: Más sabe el diablo por viejo que por diablo. / La experiencia vale más.

primary: I'm afraid we're out of stock.
example:
A: Do you have these sneakers in size 10?
B: I'm afraid we're out of stock until next week.
A: Dang, I really wanted these.
B: Try the branch downtown, they might have 'em.
A: Good idea, thanks.
B: No prob.
japanese: 在庫（ざいこ）切（ぎ）れです／売（う）り切（き）れです
chinese: 恐怕没货了 (Kǒngpà méi huò le) / 卖光了 (Mài guāng le)
spanish: A palabras necias, oídos sordos. / Ignora los comentarios tontos.

example:
A: I decided to stay home and save money.
B: Good call, the club was dead anyway.
A: Really? I feel better now.
B: Yeah, you didn't miss a thing.
A: Awesome.
B: Facts.
japanese: いい考（かんが）えだね／ナイス判断（はんだん）
chinese: 明智的决定 (Míngzhì de juédìng) / 选得好 (Xuǎn de hǎo)
spanish: Buena idea. / Bien pensado.

example:
A: I'm totally broke until payday.
B: I'm in the same boat, man.
A: Ramen for dinner then?
B: Looks like it. Let's make the best of it.
A: Done deal.
B: Bet.
japanese: 同（おな）じ状況（じょうきょう）だよ／一緒（いっしょ）だよ
chinese: 我跟你一样 (Wǒ gēn nǐ yíyàng) / 咱们同病相怜 (Zánmen tóngbìngxiānglián)
spanish: Estamos en las mismas. / Estoy igual que tú.

similar: Brought a tear to my eye.
example:
A: He wrote me a whole poem for our anniversary.
B: That's so touching! What a keeper.
A: I know, right? I was crying.
B: You guys are goals, no cap.
A: Appreciate that.
B: Much love.
japanese: 感動（かんどう）したよ／ジーンときた
chinese: 太感人了 (Tài gǎnrén le) / 戳中泪点了 (Chuōzhòng lèidiǎn le)
spanish: Qué conmovedor. / Qué tierno.

example:
A: I just won the lottery!
B: I'm speechless... are you serious?
A: Five million! No cap!
B: Yo, you're set for life now.
A: I still can't believe it.
B: Wildest thing ever.
japanese: 言葉（ことば）が出（で）ないよ
chinese: 我都无语了 (Wǒ dōu wúyǔ le) (shock/bad) / 我不知道说什么好 (Wǒ bù zhīdào shuō shénme hǎo) (moved/shock)
spanish: Me dejaste sin palabras. / No sé qué decir.

example:
A: How do I fix this broken link?
B: Honestly, I don't know a thing about coding.
A: Can you ask Tim then?
B: Yeah, he's the pro at this.
A: Thanks anyway.
B: Good luck fixin' it.
japanese: 何（なに）も知（し）らないよ
chinese: 我一无所知 (Wǒ yìwúsuǒzhī) / 我啥都不知道 (Wǒ shá dōu bù zhīdào)
spanish: No sé nada. / No tengo ni idea.

similar: What was the last thing I said?
example:
A: And then we went to the... wait, where was I?
B: You were talking about the party in Brooklyn.
A: Ah, right! So the music was fire...
B: Go on, I'm listening.
A: Anyway, it was a wild night.
B: Facts.
japanese: どこまで話（はな）したっけ？
chinese: 我刚才说到哪儿了？ (Wǒ gāngcái shuōdào nǎr le?) / 刚才聊哪了？ (Gāngcái liáo nǎ le?)
spanish: ¿En qué me quedé? / ¿De qué estaba hablando?

example:
A: Wanna grab some lunch? I'm starving.
B: Sure, where are we heading?
A: That new taco spot on the corner.
B: Heard they have the best vibes. Let's go.
A: Lead the way.
B: Bet.
japanese: お昼（ひる）食（た）べに行（い）かない？
chinese: 去吃个午饭？ (Qù chī gè wǔfàn?) / 整点儿吃的去？ (Zhěng diǎnr chīde qù?)
spanish: ¿Vamos a almorzar? / ¿Quieres ir a comer?

example:
A: You look tired today.
B: Yeah, I had a rough night. Couldn't sleep.
A: Too much coffee late at night?
B: Probably, and my neighbors were loud.
A: That's the worst. Hope you catch up later.
B: Same here.
japanese: 昨日（きのう）は大変（たいへん）だったんだ／よく眠（ねむ）れなかった
chinese: 昨晚没睡好 (Zuówǎn méi shuìhǎo) / 昨晚折腾死了 (Zuówǎn zhēteng sǐ le)
spanish: Pasé una mala noche. / No dormí nada bien.

similar: Tell me this is a joke.
example:
A: The system just crashed and deleted all files.
B: This can't be happening, we worked for weeks!
A: I'm checking the backup now.
B: It better be there, or we're finished.
A: Found it! We're safe.
B: Thank god.
japanese: 嘘（うそ）でしょ／信（しん）じられない
chinese: 这不可能是真的 (Zhè bù kěnéng shì zhēnde) / 别吓我 (Bié xià wǒ)
spanish: Esto no puede estar pasando. / No me lo puedo creer.

example:
A: Instead of working, let's hit the beach.
B: Now you're talking! The weather is too nice.
A: We can finish the work tonight.
B: Facts, let's grab the towels.
A: I'm ready.
B: Let's go!
japanese: そうこなくっちゃ！／いい話（はなし）だね
chinese: 这就对了嘛 (Zhè jiù duì le ma) / 这才像话 (Zhè cái xiànghuà)
spanish: ¡Así se habla! / ¡Ahora sí nos entendemos!

example:
A: NYC is the best city in the world, no cap.
B: You got that right, nothing like it.
A: Even with the noise and mess?
B: Especially then, that's the character.
A: Couldn't agree more.
B: Straight up.
japanese: その通（とお）りだよ
chinese: 你说得太对了 (Nǐ shuō de tài duì le) / 没错 (Méi cuò)
spanish: Tienes toda la razón. / En eso no te equivocas.

example:
A: Do you think he'll apologize?
B: Honestly, I don't see that happening.
A: He's too proud, isn't he?
B: 100%, he never admits when he's wrong.
A: Guess it's over then.
B: Probably.
japanese: そうはならないと思（おも）うよ
chinese: 我看悬 (Wǒ kàn xuán) / 我觉得不太可能 (Wǒ juéde bútài kěnéng)
spanish: No creo que pase. / Lo dudo mucho.

example:
A: Is there a meeting today at 2?
B: Not that I know of, let me check the calendar.
A: Appreciate it, I don't want to miss it.
B: Calendar says we're clear. You're good.
A: Awesome, thanks.
B: No worries.
japanese: 私（わたし）の知（し）る限（かぎ）りでは違（ちが）う／聞（き）いてないけど
chinese: 据但我知没有 (Jù dàn wǒ zhī méiyǒu) / 没听说啊 (Méi tīngshuō a)
spanish: Que yo sepa, no. / No tengo noticias de eso.

example:
A: Can I borrow your car to go to the concert?
B: Over my dead body, after what happened last time.
A: But I'll be so careful!
B: Still a no, man. End of story.
A: Well, it was worth a shot.
B: Nice try, but nah.
japanese: 絶対（ぜったい）にダメ／死（し）んでも嫌（いや）だ
chinese: 除非我死了 (Chúfēi wǒ sǐ le) / 门儿都没有 (Ménr dōu méiyǒu)
spanish: ¡Sobre mi cadáver! / ¡Ni lo sueñes!

example:
A: How's the surgery going to go?
B: I'm hoping for the best, the doctors are top notch.
A: Stay strong, we're all rooting for you.
B: Thanks, much appreciated.
A: Keep us updated.
B: Will do.
japanese: うまくいくといいね／良（よ）い結果（けっか）を願（ねが）ってる
chinese: 但愿一切顺利 (Dànyuàn yíqiè shùnlì) / 祈祷有个好结果 (Qídǎo yǒu gè hǎo jiéguǒ)
spanish: Espero que todo salga bien. / Tengo fe en que saldrá bien.

example:
A: Wanna hit the cinema tonight?
B: I'm down. What's showing?
A: That new superhero flick everyone's talking about.
B: Fire! Let's link up at 7.
A: See you then.
B: Peace.
japanese: いいよ！／賛成（さんせい）！
chinese: 我加入 (Wǒ jiārù) / 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yí gè)
spanish: ¡Me apunto! / ¡Yo le entro!

example:
A: I just saw a celebrity in the park!
B: No way! Who was it?
A: It was that guy from that show we watch.
B: That's insane! Did you get a pic?
A: Nah, I was too stunned.
B: Total miss!
japanese: まさか！／嘘（うそ）でしょ！
chinese: 不可能吧 (Bù kěnéng ba) / 不会吧 (Bú huì ba)
spanish: ¡No me digas! / ¡Increíble!

example:
A: We're heading to the pier for some air.
B: Mind if I join you? I could use a break too.
A: Of course, the more the merrier.
B: Great, let me grab my jacket.
A: Alright, hurry up.
B: On it.
japanese: 一緒（いっしょ）でもいい？／混（ま）ぜてくれる？
chinese: 介意我加入吗？ (Jièyì wǒ jiārù ma?) / 我能一起吗？ (Wǒ néng yìqǐ ma?)
spanish: ¿Les molesta si los acompaño? / ¿Puedo sentarme con ustedes?

example:
A: He didn't even like the gift I gave him.
B: Honestly, who cares? You did a nice thing anyway.
A: I guess, but it's annoying.
B: Don't stress over people like that.
A: You're right, for real.
B: Facts.
japanese: どうでもいいよ／誰（だれ）が気（き）にするの？
chinese: 谁在乎呢？ (Shéi zàihu ne?) / 管他呢 (Guǎn tā ne)
spanish: ¿A quién le importa? / ¿Qué más da?

similar: I'm not in a position to judge.
example:
A: Should I tell them they're wrong?
B: Honestly, it's not my place to interfere.
A: But it's clearly an error!
B: Let them figure it out themselves.
A: Fair enough.
B: Best way to stay clear of drama.
japanese: 私（わたし）が口出（くちだ）しすることじゃない
chinese: 轮不到我来说 (Lúnbudào wǒ lái shuō) / 不该我多嘴 (Bù gāi wǒ duōzuǐ)
spanish: No me corresponde a mí. / No es asunto mío.

similar: Go with the flow of your feelings.
example:
A: I don't know if I should take the job or travel.
B: Just follow your heart, man. Life's short.
A: Traveling has always been the dream.
B: Then go for it! The job can wait.
A: You're right, thanks for the push.
B: No doubt, enjoy.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）の気持（きも）ちに正直（しょうじき）になりなよ
chinese: 听从你的内心 (Tīngcóng nǐ de nèixīn) / 跟感觉走 (Gēn gǎnjué zǒu)
spanish: Sigue a tu corazón. / Haz lo que sientas.

primary: I wouldn't if I were you.
example:
A: Should I text my ex back?
B: Honestly, I wouldn't if I were you.
A: Why not? I miss the vibes.
B: It always ends in drama, remember?
A: True, I should stay clear.
B: Good choice.
japanese: 私（わたし）ならやめておくよ
chinese: 我是你的话就不那样做 (Wǒ shì nǐ dehuà jiù bú nàyàng zuò) / 我劝你别 (Wǒ quàn nǐ bié)
spanish: Yo que tú, no lo haría. / Yo en tu lugar, no lo haría.

example:
A: He's not doing the work correctly!
B: Just do your job and let him handle his.
A: But it affects us all!
B: Management will notice, just stay professional.
A: Fine, I'll focus on my part.
B: That's the way.
japanese: 仕事（しごと）しなよ／自分（じぶん）の役割（やくわり）を果（は）たして
chinese: 做好你的本职工作 (Zuòhǎo nǐ de běnzhí gōngzuò) / 干好你的活儿 (Gàn hǎo nǐ de huór)
spanish: Haz tu trabajo. / Dedícate a lo tuyo.

example:
A: Should I just invest a little or all of it?
B: In this market, it's all or nothing, man.
A: That's a huge risk though.
B: High risk, high reward. You down?
A: Let's do it, everything in.
B: That's the spirit.
japanese: 一（いち）か八（ばち）かだね
chinese: 孤注一掷 (Gūzhùyízhì) / 要么全有要么全无 (Yàome quányǒu yàome quánwú)
spanish: Es todo o nada. / Nos la jugamos toda.

example:
A: We're going to a fancy dinner tonight.
B: I know, I'll be good.
A: For real, behave yourself this time.
B: Relax, I can be classy when I want to.
A: I'll believe it when I see it.
B: You'll see, no cap.
japanese: 行儀（ぎょうぎ）よくしてね／いい子（こ）にしてて
chinese: 规矩点 (Guīju diǎn) / 放尊重点 (Fàng zūnzhòng diǎn)
spanish: Pórtate bien. / Compórtate.

similar: What do I get out of this?
How does this help my bag?
Give me the reason to move.
example:
A: I need you to help me move this weekend.
B: What's in it for me?
A: I'll buy the pizza and beer for everyone.
B: Now that's a deal. Count me in.
A: Good lookin' out, see ya then.
B: Bet.
japanese: 私（わたし）に何（なに）のメリットがあるの？
chinese: 我有什么好处？ (Wǒ yǒu shénme hǎochù?) / 我能捞到什么？ (Wǒ néng lāo dào shénme?)
spanish: ¿Y yo qué gano? / ¿Qué saco yo de esto?

example:
A: I lied about the results to get the bonus.
B: Shame on you! That's straight garbage.
A: I really needed the money though.
B: Doesn't excuse being a snake. No cap.
A: I feel bad now.
B: You should.
japanese: 恥（は）を知（し）れ！／みっともない！
chinese: 真丢人！ (Zhēn diūrén!) / 你真不知羞耻！ (Nǐ zhēn bùzhī xiūchǐ!)
spanish: ¡Qué vergüenza! / ¡Debería darte pena!

example:
A: You're altid late for everything!
B: You're one to talk, I waited an hour for you last week.
A: That was a one-time thing!
B: Sure it was. We're both late, let's just go.
A: Fine, fair enough.
B: Facts.
japanese: よく言（い）うよ／自分（じぶん）はどうなの
chinese: 还好意思说我 (Hái hǎoyìsi shuō wǒ) / 你也半斤八两 (Nǐ yě bànjīnbāliǎng)
spanish: Mira quién habla. / El burro hablando de orejas.

similar: Saw this coming from a mile away.
example:
A: My boss is so mad at me for missing the deadline.
B: Well, you asked for it by browsing YouTube all day.
A: I just needed a break!
B: Six hours isn't a break, it's a vacation.
A: I'm in trouble, for real.
B: Big facts.
japanese: 自業自得（じごうじとく）だよ
chinese: 你自找的 (Nǐ zìzhǎo de) / 活该 (Huógāi)
spanish: Tú te lo buscaste. / Te lo ganaste a pulso.

meaning: 꼴 좋다! 넌 그런 일 당해도 싸!
example:
A: I got a ticket for speeding again.
B: Honestly, it serves you right for being reckless.
A: It's so expensive though!
B: Maybe next time you'll slow down then.
A: Probably not, but I'll try.
B: You're hopeless, no cap.
japanese: ざまあみろ！／いい気味（きみ）だ！
chinese: 活该！ (Huógāi!) / 罪有应得！ (Zuìyǒuyīngdé!)
spanish: ¡Te lo mereces! / ¡Eso te pasa por listo!

example:
A: So we link the API to the frontend like this...
B: Oh, and then we map the data here, right?
A: Exactly! You catch on quick.
B: Just trying to keep up with the pros.
A: You're doing great, for real.
B: Appreciate the look.
japanese: 飲（の）み込（こ）みが早（はや）いね／察（さっ）しがいいね
chinese: 你上手挺快 (Nǐ shàngshǒu tǐng kuài) / 挺机灵嘛 (Tǐng jīling ma)
spanish: Aprendes rápido. / Agarras la onda rápido.

similar: Keep your head in the game.
example:
A: I have a meeting with the big boss tomorrow.
B: Don't blow it, this is your shot to move up.
A: I'm so nervous, keep shaking.
B: Just breathe and be yourself. You got this.
A: Thanks for the support.
B: No doubt, kill it.
japanese: 台無（だいな）しにしないでね／ミスるなよ
chinese: 别搞砸了 (Bié gǎozá le) / 别掉链子 (Bié diàoliànzi)
spanish: No lo arruines. / No la riegues.

meaning: 그럼 그렇게 해. / 어쩔 수 없지.
example:
A: If we don't finish by five, we're all fired.
B: Then so be it, we did our best.
A: You're so calm about this!
B: Stressing won't change the clock.
A: True, let's just finish what we can.
B: Facts.
japanese: それならそれでいい／しょうがない
chinese: 那就这样吧 (Nà jiù zhèyàng ba) / 爱咋咋地 (Ài zǎzǎdì)
spanish: Pues que así sea. / Ni modo.

example:
A: This food tastes like straight garbage.
B: Yo, watch your tongue! My mom cooked that.
A: I didn't know! Sorry about that.
B: Better apologize before she hears you.
A: My bad, I'll fix it.
B: Good.
japanese: 口（くち）の聞（き）き方（かた）に気（き）をつけて！
chinese: 说话注意点！ (Shuōhuà zhùyì diǎn!) / 嘴巴放干净点！ (Zuǐba fàng gānjìng diǎn!)
spanish: ¡Cuida esa boca! / ¡No hables así!

primary: I want no part of it.
meaning: 난 그 일에 관여하고 싶지 않아.
example:
A: We're going to sneak into the club tonight.
B: I want no part of it, I'm staying home.
A: Come on, it'll be a story!
B: A story in jail! Nah, I'm good.
A: Suit yourself then.
B: Peace.
japanese: 関（かか）わり合（あ）いたくない
chinese: 我不想掺和 (Wǒ bù xiǎng chānhuo) / 别把我扯进去 (Bié bǎ wǒ chě jìnqù)
spanish: No quiero tener nada que ver. / No me metan en eso.

example:
A: And then he said... wait, Sam, please don't butt in.
B: I was just trying to help!
A: I'm in the middle of a story, give me a sec.
B: Fine, I'll wait.
A: Thank you. Anyway, as I was saying...
B: *Sighs*.
japanese: 口出（くちだ）ししないで／割（わ）って入（はい）らないで
chinese: 请别插嘴 (Qǐng bié chāzuǐ) / 先别打岔 (Xiān bié dǎchà)
spanish: No te metas, por favor. / No interrumpas.

example:
A: Is the news that bad?
B: Brace yourself, the company is merging.
A: No way! What about our jobs?
B: That's the part where we wait and see.
A: I'm stressed already.
B: Same here, no cap.
japanese: 覚悟（かくご）して／気（き）を引き締（し）めて
chinese: 做好心理准备 (Zuòhǎo xīnlǐ zhǔnbèi) / 会很刺激 (Huì hěn cìjī)
spanish: Prepárate. / Agárrate fuerte.

example:
A: You owe me ten, but I lost your charger.
B: Let's just call it even then.
A: Perfect, I was feeling bad about that.
B: No worries, we're all good now.
A: Solid, thanks.
B: Bet.
japanese: これでチャラにしよう
chinese: 扯平了 (Chěpíng le) / 互不相欠 (Hùbùxiāngqiàn)
spanish: Digamos que estamos a mano. / Lo dejamos en paz.

example:
A: Why do you guys all wear the same shoes?
B: It's a guy thing, you wouldn't understand.
A: It looks like a uniform!
B: Respect the drip, that's just how we move.
A: If you say so.
B: Facts.
japanese: 男（おとこ）にしか分（わ）からないことだよ
chinese: 你们女人不懂 (Nǐmen nǚrén bù dǒng) / 直男那一套 (Zhínán nà yí tào)
spanish: Es cosa de hombres. / Cosas de chicos.

example:
A: My sister is staying with us for a month.
B: Great, she's gonna mooch off us the whole time.
A: She said she'd help with groceries!
B: I'll believe it when she actually pays. No cap.
A: Give her a chance, please.
B: Fine, but I'm watching.
japanese: 彼女（かのじょ）、うちらにたかる気（き）だよ
chinese: 她要来蹭吃蹭喝 (Tā yào lái cèngchīcènghē) / 她要来占便宜 (Tā yào lái zhàn piányi)
spanish: Se va a aprovechar de nosotros. / Nos va a gorronear.

example:
A: You need to clean your room today.
B: The same goes for you, look at that mess!
A: I'm doing mine later, I promise.
B: Well, I'll do mine when you do yours.
A: Fine, deal.
B: Bet on it.
japanese: 君（きみ）も同（おな）じだよ
chinese: 你也一样 (Nǐ yě yíyàng) / 彼此彼此 (Bǐcǐbǐcǐ)
spanish: Lo mismo va para ti. / Aplícate el cuento.

example:
A: Where do you want to get out?
B: Pull over right here, the museum is right there.
A: Are you sure? Traffic is heavy.
B: Yeah, I'll just walk the last bit. Thanks.
A: Alright, safe travels.
B: No doubt.
japanese: ここで止（と）めて
chinese: 就这儿停车 (Jiù zhèr tíngchē) / 靠边停 (Kàobiān tíng)
spanish: Oríllate aquí. / Déjame aquí.

example:
A: Yo, you need a ride?
B: Please! I'm freezing out here.
A: Hop in, I'll drop you home.
B: You're a lifesaver, honestly.
A: No sweat, just helping out.
B: Respect.
japanese: 乗（の）って！
chinese: 上车 (Shàngchē) / 快上来 (Kuài shànglái)
spanish: Súbete. / Entra.

example:
A: I'm heading towards Brooklyn.
B: Oh, going my way? I need to get to Bed-Stuy.
A: For sure, hop in! I'm passing right through.
B: Perfect, save me the subway fare.
A: No doubt, let's go.
B: Bet.
japanese: 同（おな）じ方向（ほうこう）？
chinese: 顺路吗？ (Shùnlù ma?) / 同路吗？ (Tónglù ma?)
spanish: ¿Vas para allá? / ¿Vamos por el mismo lado?

similar: Right in front of your face.
example:
A: Where's the new cafe?
B: Just walk down two blocks, you can't miss it.
A: Is it the one with the bright pink neon sign?
B: Precisely. You got it.
A: Alright, I'm on it.
B: Enjoy the coffee.
japanese: すぐに分（わ）かるよ／見逃（みのが）すはずないよ
chinese: 一眼就能看到 (Yìyǎn jiù néng kàndào) / 很好找 (Hěn hǎo zhǎo)
spanish: No tiene pérdida. / Lo vas a ver luego luego.

example:
A: Where are you? We're starting!
B: I'm stuck in traffic, should be there in ten.
A: That's what you said ten minutes ago!
B: NYC traffic is wild today, no cap.
A: Just hurry up already.
B: Trying my best!
japanese: 渋滞（じゅうたい）にはまっちゃった
chinese: 我堵在路上了 (Wǒ dǔ zài lùshàng le) / 堵车了 (Dǔchē le)
spanish: Estoy atorado en el tráfico. / Hay mucho tráfico.

example:
A: Wanna go on a trip to Hawaii?
B: Man, I can't afford it right now.
A: We can find cheap flights!
B: Still, rent is due soon. I gotta pass.
A: Sad, but I get it.
B: Catch you on the next one.
japanese: 買（か）う余裕（よゆう）がないよ／手（て）が出（で）ない
chinese: 我买不起 (Wǒ mǎibùqǐ) / 太贵了 (Tài guì le)
spanish: No me alcanza. / No tengo dinero para eso.

primary: Take it up with your boss.
example:
A: I want a raise for all my hard work!
B: Take it up with your boss, I don't sign the checks.
A: But you're the team lead!
B: Still, budget decisions are his move.
A: Fine, I'll go talk to him.
B: Good luck with that.
japanese: 上司（じょうし）に相談（そうだん）して
chinese: 去找你老板说 (Qù zhǎo nǐ lǎobǎn shuō) / 跟你上司也就是去 (Gēn nǐ shàngsi yě jiùshì qù)
spanish: Hablaló con tu jefe. / Díselo a tu jefe.

example:
A: This bench is a bit tight.
B: Wait, would you scoot a little so I can sit?
A: Oh, my bad! Here you go.
B: Thanks, appreciate the space.
A: No worries, all good.
B: Much better.
japanese: ちょっと詰（つ）めてくれる？
chinese: 能往那边挪挪吗？ (Néng wǎng nàbiān nuónuo ma?) / 挤挤行吗？ (Jǐji xíng ma?)
spanish: ¿Te recorres tantito? / ¿Me haces un campito?

primary: I can hold my head high.
example:
A: People are talking about your decision.
B: Let them talk, I can hold my head high.
A: You really think it was the right call?
B: 100%. I did the right thing, no cap.
A: Respect your integrity.
B: Thanks, it's what matters.
japanese: 胸（むね）を張（は）れるよ
chinese: 我问心无愧 (Wǒ wènxīnwúkuì) / 我挺直腰杆 (Wǒ tǐngzhí yāogǎn)
spanish: Puedo ir con la frente en alto. / No tengo nada de qué avergonzarme.

example:
A: Here's the key to the new place.
B: Wow, that's all I need! Finally home.
A: It looks great, for real.
B: I'm so hyped to move in.
A: Let's start unboxing.
B: Bet.
japanese: それだけで十分（じゅうぶん）だよ
chinese: 这就够了 (Zhè jiù gòu le) / 我要的就这些 (Wǒ yào de jiù zhèxiē)
spanish: Eso es todo lo que necesito. / Con eso tengo.

similar: Be out in a sec, mid-grooming.
example:
A: Are you ready yet? We're late!
B: Just a minute, I'm doing my hair.
A: You've been in there for an hour!
B: Perfection takes time, man. Relax.
A: Better look fire then.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 髪（かみ）のセットしてるの
chinese: 我在弄头发 (Wǒ zài nòng tóufa) / 在做造型 (Zài zuò zàoxíng)
spanish: Me estoy peinando. / Me estoy arreglando el pelo.

similar: Small bills for a big one?
example:
A: Can you break a hundred? I need change for the laundry.
B: Sorry, I only got twenties on me.
A: Dang, I really need those quarters.
B: Try the deli on the corner, they're always chill.
A: Good lookin' out, thanks.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 100ドル崩（くず）せますか？
chinese: 能把一百块破开吗？ (Néng bǎ yìbǎi kuài pòkāi ma?) / 有零钱吗？ (Yǒu língqián ma?)
spanish: ¿Tienes cambio de cien? / ¿Me puedes cambiar un billete de cien?

example:
A: I think they're secret agents working for the government.
B: Wow, what an imagination you have.
A: It's totally plausible though!
B: They're just librarians, man. Relax.
A: You never know...
B: Trippin', for real.
japanese: 想像（そうぞう）力（りょく）豊（ゆた）かだね
chinese: 你想象力真丰富 (Nǐ xiǎngxiànglì zhēn fēngfù) / 脑洞真大 (Nǎodòng zhēn dà)
spanish: ¡Qué imaginación tienes! / Tienes mucha imaginación.

example:
A: Haven't seen you and Tom lately. What's up?
B: Honestly, we've just grown apart over the years.
A: That's sad, you were best friends.
B: Yeah, but life moves on. No bad blood though.
A: I get it, same thing happened to me.
B: Facts.
japanese: 疎遠（そえん）になっちゃったんだ
chinese: 我们疏远了 (Wǒmen shūyuǎn le) / 关系淡了 (Guānxi dàn le)
spanish: Nos hemos distanciado. / Cada quien tomó su camino.

example:
A: Wanna hit the gym tonight?
B: Man, I just feel drained from work.
A: Long shift?
B: Ten hours of straight stress. I'm done.
A: Catch you tomorrow then.
B: Please do.
japanese: なんかドッと疲（つか）れたよ
chinese: 我感觉被掏空了 (Wǒ gǎnjué bèi tāokōng le) / 累瘫了 (Lèi tān le)
spanish: Estoy agotado. / Me siento sin fuerzas.

example:
A: Oh my god, what if I fail the audition?!
B: Yo, get a grip! You're the best one there.
A: You really think so?
B: No cap, just breathe and kill it.
A: Thanks, needed that.
B: Now go get 'em.
japanese: しっかりしろ！／落ち着け！
chinese: 清醒点！ (Qīngxǐng diǎn!) / 振作起来！ (Zhènzuò qǐlái!)
spanish: ¡Contrólate! / ¡Reacciona!

example:
A: We're heading to the city for some pizza.
B: Can I tag along? I'm starving.
A: For sure! Hop in the car.
B: Perfect, save me the subway hassle.
A: No doubt, let's roll.
B: Bet.
japanese: ついて行（い）ってもいい？
chinese: 我能跟着去吗？ (Wǒ néng gēnzhe qù ma?) / 哪怕是跟班？ (Nǎpà shì gēnbān?)
spanish: ¿Puedo ir con ustedes? / ¿Me puedo apuntar?

example:
A: Can you fill out these forms by tomorrow?
B: Man, it's such a hassle. Why so many?
A: Company policy, honestly.
B: Fine, I'll get it done. Just annoying.
A: Appreciate the effort.
B: Word.
japanese: 面倒（めんどう）くさいな
chinese: 太麻烦了 (Tài máfan le) / 真折腾 (Zhēn zhēteng)
spanish: Es un lío. / Es una lata.

example:
A: How's the new job going?
B: So far, so good. The team is cool.
A: Any issues yet?
B: Nah, just learning the ropes honestly.
A: Glad you're liking it.
B: No doubt, same.
japanese: 今（いま）のところ順調（じゅんちょう）だよ
chinese: 目前为止还不错 (Mùqián wéizhǐ hái búcuò) / 一切顺利 (Yíqiè shùnlì)
spanish: Hasta ahora, todo bien. / Por el momento, todo va bien.

example:
A: Long time no see, man! Still wearing those shoes?
B: Yup, you haven't changed a bit either, still teasing me.
A: Some things never change, for real.
B: Facts, and that's why we're friends.
A: True that.
B: Big facts.
japanese: 全（まった）く変（か）わってないね
chinese: 你一点儿都没变 (Nǐ yìdiǎnr dōu méi biàn) / 还跟以前一样 (Hái gēn yǐqián yíyàng)
spanish: No has cambiado nada. / Estás igualito.

example:
A: We missed you at the party last night.
B: Yeah, I'm just laying low for a while.
A: Everything okay?
B: Just need some time to myself, no drama.
A: Respect that, hit me up later.
B: Will do, peace.
japanese: 大人（おとな）しくしてるよ
chinese: 我最近很低调 (Wǒ zuìjìn hěn dīdiào) / 避风头 (Bì fēngtóu)
spanish: Estoy pasando desapercibido. / No quiero llamar la atención.

example:
A: I just finished my first marathon!
B: Rock on! That's a huge achievement.
A: It was tough, but I made it.
B: Proud of you, man. Inspiring work.
A: Thanks for the support!
B: Always, stay winning.
japanese: イエーイ！／最高（さいこう）！
chinese: 太棒了！ (Tài bàng le!) / 牛！ (Niú!)
spanish: ¡Genial! / ¡Dale con todo!

example:
A: Things are changing so fast in tech.
B: It's hard to keep up, honestly daily updates.
A: Tell me about it, AI is wild.
B: We just gotta keep learning.
A: Facts, no choice.
B: Bet.
japanese: ついていくのが大変（たいへん）だよ
chinese: 跟不上了 (Gēn bú shàng le) / 很难同步 (Hěn nán tóngbù)
spanish: Está difícil seguir el ritmo. / Cuesta trabajo mantenerse al día.

example:
A: I'm really tired of this project.
B: That makes two of us, man.
A: Should we take a break?
B: Actually, yeah. Let's grab some coffee.
A: Good idea.
B: Facts.
japanese: 私（わたし）も同（おな）じだよ
chinese: 我也一样 (Wǒ yě yíyàng) / 咱俩彼此彼此 (Zánliǎ bǐcǐbǐcǐ)
spanish: Ya somos dos. / Estamos igual.

example:
A: I failed the test and I worked so hard...
B: There, there. You'll do better next time.
A: I feel like such a failure.
B: Don't speak like that. You're smart, just a bad day.
A: Thanks, I needed that.
B: Anytime.
japanese: よしよし／大丈夫（だいじょうぶ）だよ
chinese: 好了好了 (Hǎo le hǎo le) / 没事了 (Méishì le)
spanish: Ya, ya. / Tranquilo, todo va a estar bien.

example:
A: They cancelled the event after we set it all up.
B: It was all for nothing! All that hard work...
A: I'm really tight about this.
B: Me too, man. Total garbage move by management.
A: Lessons learned, I guess.
B: Sad facts.
japanese: 全（ぜん）部無駄（むだ）だったよ
chinese: 全都白费了 (Quándōu báifèi le) / 竹篮打水一场空 (Zhúlán dǎ shuǐ yìchángkōng)
spanish: Fue para nada. / Todo fue en vano.

similar: Too many tasks, too little time.
example:
A: Why didn't you call me earlier?
B: Honestly, there wasn't time. It was chaotic.
A: You couldn't even send a text?
B: No, I was literally running around all day.
A: Fine, I get it now.
B: Appreciate the understanding.
japanese: 時間（じかん）がなかったんだ
chinese: 没时间了 (Méi shíjiān le) / 来不及了 (Láibují le)
spanish: No hubo tiempo. / No alcanzó el tiempo.

similar: Caught between a rock and a hard place.
example:
A: I accidentally booked two flights for the same day.
B: Man, I'm in a bind. I can't afford both.
A: Call the airline and explain.
B: I tried, they're being tough. What should I do?
A: Keep pushing, someone will help.
B: Hope so, I'm stressed.
japanese: 困（こま）ったことになった
chinese: 我左右为难 (Wǒ zuǒyòuwéinán) / 陷入困境了 (Xiànrù kùnjìng le)
spanish: Estoy en un aprieto. / Estoy en problemas.

example:
A: Have you seen Mike lately?
B: Nah, he's always on the go with his business trips.
A: Must be exhausting.
B: For real, I don't know how he does it.
A: Hustle is real, I guess.
B: Big facts.
japanese: 彼（かれ）はずっと動（うご）き回（まわ）ってるね
chinese: 他总是忙个不停 (Tā zǒngshì máng gè bùtíng) / 东奔西跑的 (Dōngbēnxīpǎo de)
spanish: Siempre anda de un lado para el otro. / No para nunca.

example:
A: He said he'd give us the money for free.
B: I smell a rat. Nobody does that for nothing.
A: You think it's a scam?
B: 100%. Don't sign anything, man.
A: Good lookin' out, I'm staying clear.
B: Smart move.
japanese: なんか怪（あや）しいな
chinese: 我觉得有猫腻 (Wǒ juéde yǒu māonì) / 不对劲 (Bú duìjìn)
spanish: Aquí huele mal. / Algo me huele raro.

example:
A: You ready for dinner?
B: Man, I could eat a horse. I haven't eaten all day.
A: Well, the buffet is right there.
B: Watch me clear the whole table.
A: Haha, go for it then.
B: Bet.
japanese: 腹（はら）ペコだよ／死（し）ぬほどお腹（なか）空（す）いた
chinese: 我饿得能吃下一头牛 (Wǒ è de néng chī xià yìtóu niú) / 饿死我了 (È sǐ wǒ le)
spanish: Me muero de hambre. / Tengo un hambre que no veo.

similar: Listen closer to the main thing.
example:
A: But the budget doesn't allow for it...
B: Yo, you're all missing my point! It's about the quality.
A: We get that, but money is tight.
B: If we fail on quality, the money doesn't matter!
A: Ah, I see what you're saying now.
B: Finally.
japanese: みんな論点（ろんてん）がズレてるよ
chinese: 你们都没抓到重点 (Nǐmen dōu méi zhuādào zhòngdiǎn) / 跑题了 (Pǎotí le)
spanish: No me están entendiendo. / Se les está yendo el punto.

example:
A: That guy is a straight... well, pardon my language.
B: No worries, he's annoying us both.
A: Just so frustrated with the service.
B: I feel you, but let's keep it classy.
A: True, my bad.
B: All good.
japanese: 汚（きたな）い言葉（ことば）でごめんね
chinese: 恕我言辞粗鲁 (Shù wǒ yáncí cūlǔ) / 话可能不太好听 (Huà kěnéng bútài hǎotīng)
spanish: Perdón por la palabrota. / Disculpen mi vocabulario.

example:
A: So about the partnership...
B: Let's just talk turkey. What are the numbers?
A: Straight to the point, I like it.
B: I don't have all day, man. What's the split?
A: 60/40, your favor.
B: Now we're talking.
japanese: 本音（ほんね）で話（はな）そう／腹（はら）を割（わ）って話（はな）そう
chinese: 打开天窗说亮话吧 (Dǎkāi tiānchuāng shuō liànghuà ba) / 说正事吧 (Shuō zhèngshì ba)
spanish: Hablemos claro. / Vamos al grano.

example:
A: So, I was thinking about the project and...
B: Just come to the point, man. Are you leaving?
A: Yeah, I got a better offer elsewhere.
B: Hard to hear, but thanks for the honesty.
A: Appreciate the understanding.
B: Good luck out there.
japanese: 単刀直入（たんとうちょくにゅう）に言（い）うね
chinese: 我就直说了 (Wǒ jiù zhíshuō le) / 言归正传 (Yánguīzhèngzhuàn)
spanish: Iré al grano. / Seré directo.

similar: Doesn't matter in the long run.
example:
A: He said he's going to tell the boss!
B: Whatever, it carries no weight. He has zero proof.
A: Are you sure? He looked serious.
B: 100%. He's just trying to scare you.
A: Thanks, feeling better now.
B: Keep your head up.
japanese: そんなの説得力（せっとくりょく）ないよ
chinese: 没分量 (Méi fènliàng) / 说话不顶用 (Shuōhuà bù dǐngyòng)
spanish: Eso no tiene importancia. / No pesa nada.

example:
A: I've been working for twelve hours straight.
B: Yo, go home and put your feet up. You deserved it.
A: Still got a few things to finish...
B: They'll be there tomorrow. Go rest.
A: I guess you're right.
B: No doubt, sleep well.
japanese: ゆっくり休（やす）んで
chinese: 好好歇歇 (Hǎohǎo xiēxie) / 放松一下 (Fàngsōng yíxià)
spanish: Descansa un rato. / Relájate.

example:
A: But what did he really mean by that?
B: Seriously, just drop the subject. I'm over it.
A: My bad, I was just curious.
B: It's ancient history now. Next topic.
A: Understood.
B: Thanks.
japanese: その話（はなし）はやめよう
chinese: 别提这事了 (Bié tí zhè shì le) / 换个话题 (Huàn gè huàtí)
spanish: Cambia de tema. / Ya déjalo así.

example:
A: Are we still going to Japan next month?
B: Honestly, everything's up in the air right now.
A: Why? Flight issues?
B: Yeah, and the hotel cancelled. We'll see.
A: Hope it works out.
B: Same here.
japanese: まだ何（なに）も決（き）まってないんだ
chinese: 一切都还没定 (Yíqiè dōu hái méi dìng) / 悬而未决 (Xuán'érwèijué)
spanish: Todo está en el aire. / No hay nada seguro todavía.

similar: Good lookin' out on the walk.
example:
A: Here we are, your building.
B: Thanks for walking me home, I really appreciate it.
A: No worries, wouldn't let you walk alone at night.
B: You're a true friend. See ya tomorrow.
A: Definitely, sleep well.
B: You too.
japanese: 送（おく）ってくれてありがとう
chinese: 谢谢你送我回家 (Xièxie nǐ sòng wǒ huíjiā) / 感谢护送 (Gǎnxiè hùsòng)
spanish: Gracias por acompañarme a casa. / Gracias por llevarme.

example:
A: I wonder where Tim is, he's always late.
B: Yo, speak of the devil! Here he comes now.
C: Sorry guys, the subway was buggin'.
A: We were literally just talking about you.
B: Hilarious timing.
C: My ears were ringing, for real.
japanese: 噂（うわさ）をすれば！
chinese: 说曹操曹操到！ (Shuō Cáocāo Cáocāo dào!)
spanish: ¡Hablando del rey de Roma! / ¡Mira quién llegó!

example:
A: Who gets the front seat?
B: Heads or tails! Let's flip for it.
A: Heads!
B: *Flips coin*... It's tails! My seat.
A: Dang, best two out of three?
B: Nah, one and done. Move it.
japanese: 表（おもて）か裏（うら）か！
chinese: 正面还是反面！ (Zhèngmiàn háishì fǎnmiàn!) / 猜硬币！ (Cāi yìngbì!)
spanish: ¡Águila o sol! / ¡Cara o cruz!

example:
A: Yo, what's good? You out tonight?
B: Nah, just kicking in at home, honestly.
A: Boring! Come out for a bit.
B: My body needs this rest, man. Enjoy the night.
A: Alright, catch you later.
B: Peace.
japanese: まったりしてるよ
chinese: 正歇着呢 (Zhèng xiēzhe ne) / 宅着呢 (Zhái zhe ne)
spanish: Aquí descansando. / Relajándome en casa.

example:
A: I'm too nervous to sign up for the talent show.
B: Just put yourself out there, man! You're amazing.
A: What if they laugh?
B: Who cares? At least you tried. Own the stage.
A: Alright, I'll sign up tonight.
B: That's the energy I like to see.
japanese: 積極的（せっきくてき）に行（い）こう／出会（であ）いの場（ば）に行（い）こう
chinese: 大胆去尝试 (Dàdǎn qù chángshì) / 豁出去展现自己 (Huōchuqù zhǎnxiàn zìjǐ)
spanish: ¡Lánzate! / ¡Arriésgate!

example:
A: Are you leaving me too?
B: Never. You're all I've got in this world.
A: Really? I feel so alone sometimes.
B: I'm here for you, always. No cap.
A: Thank you for staying.
B: Always.
japanese: 頼（たよ）れるのは君（きみ）だけだよ
chinese: 我只要你 (Wǒ zhǐ yào nǐ) / 你就是我的全部 (Nǐ jiùshì wǒ de quánbù)
spanish: Eres todo lo que tengo. / No tengo a nadie más que a ti.

example:
A: He cancelled the meeting last minute again.
B: That figures, he's never on time with anything.
A: It's so frustrating though.
B: Don't let it get to you, that's just him.
A: Truth, I'm over it.
B: Good.
japanese: やっぱりね／そう来（く）ると思（おも）った
chinese: 果然如此 (Guǒrán rúcǐ) / 意料之中 (Yìliào zhī zhōng)
spanish: Me lo imaginaba. / Era de esperarse.

example:
A: Should I take the free tickets to the game?
B: What's there to think about? Just go!
A: But I have work tomorrow...
B: It's the finals, man! You can't miss this.
A: You're right, I'm in.
B: Smart move, for real.
japanese: 考（かんガ）える必要（ひつよう）なんてないでしょ？
chinese: 这还用想吗？ (Zhè hái yòng xiǎng ma?) / 没啥好犹豫的 (Méi shá hǎo yóuyù de)
spanish: ¿Qué hay que pensar? / ¡No lo pienses más!

example:
A: Can't you just change the grade for me?
B: Sorry, it's out of my hands. The registrar has the final say.
A: But I was only one point off!
B: I know, but I can't override the system now.
A: Worth a shot, I guess.
B: Don't give up though.
japanese: 私（わたし）の手（て）には負（お）えない／どうしようもない
chinese: 我无能为力 (Wǒ wúnéngwéilì) / 管不了了 (Guǎn bùliǎo le)
spanish: No está en mis manos. / Ya no depende de mí.

example:
A: Are you still biting your nails?
B: Yeah, old habits die hard, man.
A: I thought you stopped last week!
B: I tried, but stress got the best of me.
A: Keep trying, you'll get there.
B: Eventually, no doubt.
japanese: 昔（むかし）の癖（くせ）はなかなか抜（ヌ）けないね
chinese: 积习难改 (Jīxí nángǎi) / 老毛病改不掉 (Lǎo máobìng gǎi bú diào)
spanish: Las viejas costumbres tardan en morir. / Genio y figura hasta la sepultura.

primary: Is that what I think it is?
example:
A: *Pulls out a box*... Happy birthday!
B: Is that what I think it is? The new gaming console?!
A: Yup! No cap, it's yours.
B: Oh my god, you're the best ever!
A: Enjoy it, you earned it.
B: Hype is real!
japanese: それってまさかアレ？
chinese: 该不会是我想的那个吧？ (Gāi búhuì shì wǒ xiǎng de nàge ba?) / 是不是那个？ (Shìbushì nàge?)
spanish: ¿Es lo que creo que es? / ¿Es eso lo que pienso?

example:
A: But the plan changed at the last minute!
B: Just go with it, man. It'll be fine.
A: I hate surprises though.
B: New plan is actually better, trust me.
A: Alright, I'll try to stay chill.
B: That's the spirit.
japanese: 流（なが）れに身（み）を任（まか）せなよ／とりあえず受（う）け入（い）れなよ
chinese: 顺其自然吧 (Shùnqízìrán ba) / 就这么着吧 (Jiù zhèmezhe ba)
spanish: Solo síguele la corriente. / Déjate llevar.

primary: In one ear and out the other.
meaning: 한 귀로 듣고 한 귀로 흘려버려.
example:
A: Did you remind him about the groceries?
B: Yeah, but it went in one ear and out the other.
A: Again?! He's so forgetful.
B: I'll text him next time, maybe that'll stick.
A: Good luck with that.
B: Hopefully.
japanese: 馬耳東風（ばじとうふう）だね／右（みぎ）から左（ひだり）へ受（う）け流（なが）してる
chinese: 左耳进右耳出 (Zuǒ'ěr jìn yòu'ěr chū) / 当耳旁风 (Dāng ěrpángfēng)
spanish: Le entra por un oído y le sale por el otro. / No hace caso.

example:
A: Little Tim is already fixing cars like his dad.
B: Like father, like son, honestly. It's in the blood.
A: He's quite talented for his age.
B: Definitely, learned from the best.
A: Future pro right there.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 蛙（かえる）の子（こ）は蛙（かえる）だね／似（に）たもの親子（おやこ）だね
chinese: 有其父必有其子 (Yǒu qí fù bì yǒu qí zǐ) / 一个模子刻出来的 (Yí gè múzi kè chūlái de)
spanish: De tal palo, tal astilla. / Hijo de tigre, pintito.

example:
A: Fine, I'm leaving then.
B: Sit down, we're not done here. We need to settle this.
A: What else is there to say?!
B: A lot, for starters. Relax and listen.
A: Fine, I'm listening.
B: Good.
japanese: 話（はなし）はまだ終（お）わってないよ
chinese: 我们还没说完呢 (Wǒmen hái méi shuōwán ne) / 这事没完 (Zhè shì méiwán)
spanish: Aún no terminamos. / Esto no se ha acabado.

example:
A: You ready to jump?
B: Here goes nothing! Woooo!
A: Wow, he actually did it!
B: That was wild, man! My heart is pounding.
A: You absolute madman.
B: Life on the edge, facts.
japanese: ダメ元（もと）でやってみよう
chinese: 豁出去了 (Huōchuqù le) / 死马当活马医 (Sǐmǎ dāng huómǎ yī)
spanish: Aquí voy. / ¡A ver qué pasa!

example:
A: Should I ask her out now or wait later?
B: It's now or never, man. She's leaving tomorrow.
A: You're right, I'm going for it.
B: Do it! I'm rooting for you.
A: Wish me luck.
B: Kill it, no cap.
japanese: 今（いま）やるしかないよ
chinese: 机不可失 (Jībùkěshī) / 此时不待 (Cǐshí búdài)
spanish: Es ahora o nunca. / Es el momento.

example:
A: You look like a zombie today.
B: Man, I didn't sleep a wink last night. Stressed about work.
A: That's rough. Need a coffee?
B: I need an entire gallon of it. Make it extra strong.
A: I got you.
B: Lifesaver.
japanese: 一睡（いっすい）もできなかった
chinese: 我一夜没合眼 (Wǒ yíyè méi héyǎn) / 完全没睡 (Wánquán méi shuì)
spanish: No pegué el ojo. / No dormí nada.

primary: I'm just having a bad day.
example:
A: Why are you so grumpy?
B: I'm just having a bad day, sorry I'm taking it out on you.
A: All good, we all have those moments.
B: Failed my test and lost my wallet... just wild.
A: Oof, sorry to hear that. Want a donut?
B: Actually, yeah. That would help.
japanese: 今日（きょう）はついてないんだ
chinese: 我今天心情不好 (Wǒ jīntiān xīnqíng bùhǎo) / 今天诸事不顺 (Jīntiān zhūshì búshùn)
spanish: Solo estoy teniendo un mal día. / Hoy no es mi día.

example:
A: I'm quitting my job to become a professional clown.
B: You can't be serious... tell me you're joking.
A: I'm 100% serious, I already got the shoes.
B: Man, you're wild. Good luck with the nose then.
A: Honk honk!
B: Oh boy.
japanese: 冗談（じょうだん）でしょ？／本気（ほんき）じゃないよね？
chinese: 你不是认真的吧 (Nǐ búshì rènzhēn de ba) / 别开玩笑了 (Bié kāiwánxiào le)
spanish: No puedes hablar en serio. / ¿Es broma, verdad?

similar: See where I'm going with this?
example:
A: So we link the database and then map the UI... get the picture?
B: Yeah, I see it now. The integration looks smooth.
A: Perfect, let's start coding it then.
B: No doubt, let's get it.
A: Solid progress.
B: Bet.
japanese: 状況（じょうきょう）飲み込（こ）めた？／わかった？
chinese: 明白了吗？ (Míngbai le ma?) / 懂我意思吗？ (Dǒng wǒ yìsi ma?)
spanish: ¿Ya entendiste? / ¿Te cae el veinte?

example:
A: You look awful! What happened to you?
B: Flu hit me hard last night, stayed up shivering.
A: Stay home and rest, don't spread that.
B: I'm trying, but I have so much to do.
A: Work can wait, health first.
B: You're right, I'm heading back to bed.
japanese: 顔色（かおいろ）悪（わる）いよ／ひどい格好（かっこう）だね
chinese: 你脸色很差 (Nǐ liǎnsè hěn chà) / 你看起来很糟糕 (Nǐ kànqǐlái hěn zāogāo)
spanish: Te ves fatal. / Tienes mala cara.

example:
A: He said he'll give me a full refund if I send him my password.
B: Don't fall for it! That's a classic scam.
A: Really? He sounded so professional.
B: They all do, man. Just block him already.
A: Good lookin' out, close call.
B: Facts, stay safe out here.
japanese: 騙（だま）されちゃダメだよ
chinese: 别上当 (Bié shàngdàng) / 别被忽悠了 (Bié bèi hūyou le)
spanish: No te lo creas. / No caigas.

example:
A: Should I sign the contract?
B: What's your gut feeling?
A: Something feels off.
B: Then don't sign it.
A: You think?
B: Always trust your gut.
japanese: 直感（ちょっかん）
chinese: 直觉 (Zhíjué) / 第六感 (Dìliùgǎn)
spanish: Intuición. / Corazonada.

example:
A: I can't decide between these two jobs.
B: Just go with your gut.
A: Logic says Job A, gut says Job B.
B: Job B will make you happier.
A: You're probably right.
B: Logic is overrated sometimes.
japanese: 直感（ちょっかん）に従（したが）いなよ
chinese: 跟着感觉走 (Gēnzhe gǎnjué zǒu) / 相信你的直觉 (Xiāngxìn nǐ de zhíjué)
spanish: Sigue tu instinto. / Haz caso a tu corazonada.

example:
A: Your impression of him was spot on.
B: I practiced it.
A: It was hilarious.
B: I noticed his little ticks.
A: You should be an actor.
B: Maybe in another life.
japanese: その通（とお）り／完璧（かんぺき）
chinese: 完全正确 (Wánquán zhèngquè) / 说得太准了 (Shuō de tài zhǔn le)
spanish: Exacto. / Diste en el clavo.

example:
A: He hired me on the spot.
B: That's amazing!
A: I was shocked.
B: You must have impressed him.
A: I just was myself.
B: Best strategy.
japanese: その場（ば）ですぐに／即座（そくざ）に
chinese: 当场 (Dāngchǎng) / 即兴 (Jíxìng) (if music/speech)
spanish: Al instante. / En el acto.

example:
A: Why did you ask me that in front of everyone?
B: I didn't mean to put you on the spot.
A: I froze up completely.
B: Sorry, I thought you knew the answer.
A: Next time, warn me.
B: Won't happen again.
japanese: 困（こま）らせる／追（お）い詰（つ）める
chinese: 让人难堪 (Ràng rén nánkān) / 让人下不来台 (Ràng rén xià bu lái tái)
spanish: Poner en evidencia. / Poner en un aprieto.

example:
A: Who's that guy?
B: That's my homie from Queens.
A: He seems cool.
B: Yeah, we go way back.
A: Introduce me.
B: Sure, come say hi.
japanese: ダチ／親友（しんゆう）
chinese: 死党 (Sǐdǎng) / 哥们儿 (Gēmenr) / 老铁 (Lǎotiě)
spanish: Amigo. / Compa.

example:
A: Wanna play games?
B: Can't, I gotta run some errands.
A: Boring.
B: Adulting sucks.
A: Call me when you're done.
B: Will do, give me two hours.
japanese: 野暮用（やぼよう）を済（す）ませる／お使（つか）いに行（い）く
chinese: 去办点杂事 (Qù bàn diǎn záshì) / 跑腿 (Pǎotuǐ)
spanish: Hacer mandados. / Hacer vueltas.

example:
A: It's getting late.
B: Yeah, we should hit the road.
A: Before traffic gets bad.
B: Did you pack the snacks?
A: Got 'em.
B: Let's roll.
japanese: 出発（しゅっぱつ）する／出（で）かける
chinese: 上路 (Shànglù) / 出发 (Chūfā)
spanish: Irse. / Ponerse en camino.

example:
A: I'm going to Coachella!
B: Have a blast!
A: I'm so excited.
B: Drink water, stay safe.
A: I will, mom.
B: Send pics.
japanese: 思（おも）いっきり楽（たの）しんで
chinese: 玩得开心 (Wán de kāixīn) / 嗨翻天 (Hāi fāntiān)
spanish: Diviértete mucho. / Pásatela súper.

example:
A: *poking arm*
B: Cut it out!
A: I'm just annoying you.
B: It's working.
A: You love me though.
B: Debatable right now.
japanese: いい加減（かげん）にして／やめて
chinese: 省省吧 (Shěngsheng ba) / 够了 (Gòu le)
spanish: ¡Ya párale! / ¡Basta ya!

example:
A: Here's your receipt.
B: Thanks, have a good one.
A: You too.
B: *walks out*
A: Next in line!
B: (to self) Finally got my coffee.
japanese: じゃあね／良（よ）い一日（いちにち）を
chinese: 祝你愉快 (Zhù nǐ yúkuài) / 回见 (Huíjiàn)
spanish: Que tengas buen día. / Nos vemos.

example:
A: Why is the train stopped?
B: Beats me.
A: It's been twenty minutes.
B: Maybe signal problems.
A: I'm gonna be late.
B: Welcome to the subway.
japanese: さっぱり分（わ）からない
chinese: 难倒我了 (Nándǎo wǒ le) / 我哪知道 (Wǒ nǎ zhīdào)
spanish: Ni idea. / Quién sabe.

example:
A: Bu!
B: Ah! My heart skipped a beat.
A: Did I scare you?
B: Yes, don't do that.
A: You jump so easily.
B: I hate surprises.
japanese: 心臓（しんぞう）が止（と）まるかと思（おも）った／ドキッとした
chinese: 我心里咯噔一下 (Wǒ xīnli gēdēng yíxià) / 吓我一跳 (Xià wǒ yí tiào)
spanish: Se me paró el corazón. / Me dio un vuelco el corazón.

example:
A: We want a table for two.
B: Sure.
A: Is there a wait?
B: About 45 minutes.
A: We'll go somewhere else.
B: Weekends are busy.
japanese: 待（ま）ち時間（じかん）ある？
chinese: 要排队吗？ (Yào páiduì ma?) / 要等位吗？ (Yào děngwèi ma?)
spanish: ¿Hay que esperar mucho? / ¿Hay lista de espera?

example:
A: This laptop is cheap.
B: But does it work well?
A: Best bang for the buck.
B: Read the reviews first.
A: They're all five stars.
B: Buy it then.
japanese: コスパがいい
chinese: 性价比高 (Xìngjiàbǐ gāo) / 很划算 (Hěn huásuàn)
spanish: Vale la pena. / Buena relación calidad-precio.

example:
A: Did I say that out loud?
B: Yes, everyone heard you.
A: Oops. How embarrassing.
B: It was kinda funny though.
A: I need a filter.
B: No, keep being you.
japanese: 声（こえ）に出（だ）して
chinese: 大声地 (Dàshēng de) / 朗读 (Lǎngdú)
spanish: En voz alta. / Para que se oiga.

example:
A: Cold beer after work.
B: Oh yeah, it hits the spot.
A: Nothing better.
B: Maybe a burger too?
A: Don't tempt me.
B: Let's do it.
japanese: これこれ、こういうのが欲（ほ）しかったんだ／たまらないね
chinese: 正合我意 (Zhènghéwǒyì) / 太爽了 (Tài shuǎng le) (food/drink)
spanish: Cayó de perlas. / Justo lo que necesitaba.

example:
A: I'm so stressed about finals.
B: Just hang loose, you studied.
A: Easy for you to say.
B: Panicking won't help.
A: I guess.
B: Let's go for a walk.
japanese: 気楽（きらく）に行（い）こうよ
chinese: 放轻松 (Fàng qīngsōng) / 别紧张 (Bié jǐnzhāng)
spanish: Relájate. / Tómalo con calma.

example:
A: What do they sell?
B: Electronics, clothes, food, you name it.
A: Like a superstore?
B: Basically Amazon in real life.
A: Convenient.
B: But dangerous for my wallet.
japanese: 何（なん）でも言（い）って／ありとあらゆるもの
chinese: 应有尽有 (Yīngyǒujìnyǒu) / 你能想到的都有 (Nǐ néng xiǎngdào de dōu yǒu)
spanish: Lo que sea. / Lo que se te ocurra.

primary: Every cloud has a silver lining
example:
A: I got fired.
B: Every cloud has a silver lining.
A: What's the silver lining here?
B: You hated that boss.
A: True. I'm free.
B: Exactly. Upgrade time.
japanese: 捨（す）てる神（かみ）あれば拾（ひろ）う神（かみ）あり／希望（きぼう）はあるよ
chinese: 塞翁失马焉知非福 (Sàiwēngshīmǎ yānzhīfēifú) / 总有一线希望 (Zǒngyǒu yíxiàn xīwàng)
spanish: No hay mal que por bien no venga. / Siempre hay un lado positivo.

example:
A: Why didn't you come last night?
B: I was spread too thin with work.
A: You work too much.
B: I need the money.
A: You need a break.
B: Tell my landlord that.
japanese: 手（て）を広（ひろ）げすぎちゃった／キャパオーバーだった
chinese: 分身乏术 (Fēnshēnfáshù) / 忙不过来 (Máng bú guòlái)
spanish: Estaba saturado. / Quería hacer demasiadas cosas.

example:
A: They're gonna grill me in the meeting.
B: Don't worry, I got your back.
A: Thanks, I'm nervous.
B: We're a team.
A: I appreciate it.
B: Let's crush this.
japanese: 私がついてるよ／援護（えんご）するよ
chinese: 我挺你 (Wǒ tǐng nǐ) / 我是你坚强的后盾 (Wǒ shì nǐ jiānqiáng de hòudùn)
spanish: Yo te cubro. / Cuentas conmigo.

example:
A: Are you done with the intro?
B: Yes. Without further ado, here is our guest.
A: Finally.
B: I like to build suspense.
A: You like to talk.

chinese: 有心事吗？ (Yǒu xīnshì ma?) / 遇到什么麻烦了吗？ (Yùdào shénme máfan le ma?)
spanish: ¿Te pasa algo? / ¿Tienes algo?

primary: It's nothing. Don't worry about it.
example:
A: What did you say?
B: It's nothing. Don't worry about it.
A: Are you mad?
B: Nah, it's nothing. Don't worry about it.
A: Sorry I broke your pen.
B: It's nothing. Don't worry about it, I have ten more.
japanese: なんでもないよ、気（き）にしないで
chinese: 没事，别担心 (Méishì, bié dānxīn) / 没啥事，别往心里去 (Méi shá shì, bié wǎng xīnli qù)
spanish: No es nada, no te preocupes. / Olvídalo, todo bien.

meaning: 고통받느니 죽는 게 낫지 / 힘들게 사느니 죽고 말지
example:
A: We have to walk 20 blocks in the rain.
B: I'd rather die than suffer through that. Uber?
A: You want to watch that 4-hour documentary?
B: I'd rather die than suffer that boredom.
A: Drama with the ex again?
B: Ugh, I'd rather die than suffer his nonsense.
japanese: 苦（くる）しむくらいなら死（し）んだ方（ほう）がマシだ
chinese: 我宁死也不愿受这罪 (Wǒ nìngsǐ yě búyuàn shòu zhè zuì) / 让我受罪还不如杀了我 (Ràng wǒ shòuzuì hái bùrú shā le wǒ)
spanish: Prefiero morir que sufrir. / Antes muerto que aguantar eso.

example:
A: How was the interview?
B: It was so nerve racking, I was shaking.
A: Waiting for the results is nerve racking.
B: Tell me about it, my heart is pounding.
A: First dates are always nerve racking.
B: Just be yourself, you got this.
japanese: ハラハラする／神経（しんけい）すり減（へ）らす
chinese: 伤神 (Shāngshén) / 让人提心吊胆 (Ràng rén tíxīndiàodǎn)
spanish: Estresante. / Me pone de los nervios.

example:
A: Why are you being so nice to Dad?
B: Trying to butter him up so I can borrow the car.
A: She's totally trying to butter up the boss.
B: Yeah, she wants that promotion bad.
A: Don't try to butter me up, you're still grounded.
B: Worth a shot though, right?
japanese: ゴマをする／おだてる
chinese: 讨好 (Tǎohǎo) / 巴结 (Bājie)
spanish: Hacer la barba. / Adular.

example:
A: Look at him bringing coffee for everyone.
B: Total brown nose move.
A: Nobody likes a brown nose.
B: But the boss loves him, so who's winning?
A: Stop being a brown nose and have an opinion.
B: I'm just being a team player!
japanese: ご機嫌取（きげんと）り／腰巾着（こしぎんちゃく）
chinese: 马屁精 (Mǎpìjīng) / 舔狗 (Tiǎngǒu) (slang, harsh)
spanish: Lambiscón. / Barbero.

example:
A: You'll never guess who I bumped into today.
B: Who? Your ex?
A: I bumped into Sarah at the bodega.
B: No way, how is she doing?
A: Always awkward when you bump into a coworker on the weekend.
B: Pretend you didn't see them. Valid strategy.
japanese: ばったり会（あ）った
chinese: 偶遇 (Ǒuyù) / 碰见 (Pèngjiàn)
spanish: Me encontré con. / Tropecé con.

example:
A: Sorry, I think I bumped against your table.
B: It's cool, no water spilled.
A: The subway was so crowded, I bumped against like ten people.
B: Rush hour vibes, gotta love it.
A: I bumped against the wall in the dark.
B: Ouch, you okay?
japanese: ぶつかった
chinese: 撞到 (Zhuàngdào) / 磕到 (Kēdào)
spanish: Choqué con. / Me golpeé contra.

primary: I bumped my toes on the doorframe
example:
A: *Screams silently*
B: What happened? You look in pain.
A: I bumped my toes on the doorframe.
B: The worst pain known to man. RIP.
A: I need steel-toed boots in this house.
B: Clumsy much?
japanese: ドア枠（わく）に足（あし）の指（ゆび）ぶつけた
chinese: 我脚趾撞门框上了 (Wǒ jiǎozhǐ zhuàng ménkuàng shàng le) / 踢到门框了，疼死 (Tī dào ménkuàng le, téng sǐ)
spanish: Me pegué en los dedos del pie. / Me di un golpe en el pie.

example:
A: He let her cancel again?
B: Yeah, he's such a pushover.
A: Don't be a pushover, tell them no.
B: It's hard, I hate conflict.
A: They treat the substitute teacher like a pushover.
B: Kids can be ruthless.
japanese: チョロい人（ひと）／言（い）いなりになる人（ひと）
chinese: 软柿子 (Ruǎnshìzi) / 耳根子软的人 (Ěrgēnzi ruǎn de rén)
spanish: Dejado. / Fácil de manipular.

example:
A: That guy is cute. Is he spoken for?
B: I think he has a girlfriend.
A: Are you spoken for, or can I buy you a drink?
B: I'm spoken for, but thanks for the offer.
A: Everyone at this party is spoken for.
B: Single life is rough out here.
japanese: 誰（だれ）か付（つ）き合（あ）ってる人（ひと）いる？
chinese: 名花有主了吗？ (Mínghuāyǒuzhǔ le ma?) / 有对象了吗？ (Yǒu duìxiàng le ma?)
spanish: ¿Tienes compromiso? / ¿Estás saliendo con alguien?

meaning: 걔 사진 찍는 거 싫어해 / 카메라 공포증 있어
example:
A: Let's take a selfie!
B: Don't ask Mike, he is pretty camera shy.
A: Why are there no photos of him online?
B: He is pretty camera shy, likes his privacy.
A: He hid his face again.
B: Yeah, he is pretty camera shy.
japanese: 彼（かれ）、写真（しゃしん）嫌（ぎら）いなんだ
chinese: 他挺害羞的，不喜欢拍照 (Tā tǐng hàixiū de, bù xǐhuan pāizhào) / 他有点镜头恐惧症 (Tā yǒudiǎn jìngtóu kǒngjùzhèng)
spanish: Le da pena la cámara. / No le gusta que le tomen fotos.

example:
A: My feed is still showing posts from yesterday, what's wrong?
B: Just pull down to refresh, it probably just needs a quick sync.
A: I already tried that, but it's still stuck on the same photo.
B: Maybe your wifi is trippin'. Try switching to data.
A: Oh, that worked. Now I see all the new drama.
B: Perfect. Now you can get back to being a hater, haha.
japanese: 引（ひ）っ張（ぱ）って更新（こうしん）
chinese: 下拉刷新 (Xiàlā shuāxīn)
spanish: Desliza para actualizar. / Jala hacia abajo para refrescar.

example:
A: I'm quitting my job on Friday, but not a word to anyone yet.
B: Wait, what? Are you serious? Where are you going?
A: I got an offer from that startup in Brooklyn, but it's not official.
B: That's huge! I promise, my lips are sealed. Not a word.
A: Thank you. I don't want any corporate drama before I leave.
B: I got you. Your secret is totally safe with me.
japanese: 誰（だれ）にも言（い）っちゃダメだよ
chinese: 一个字都别说 (Yí gè zì dōu bié shuō) / 守口如瓶 (Shǒukǒurúpíng)
spanish: Ni una palabra. / Calladito.

meaning: 알았어, 더 말 안 해도 이해했어 (바로 할게)
example:
A: Can you grab some ice on your way to the party tonight?
B: Say less, I'll pick up two bags and some extra cups too.
A: You're a lifesaver, everyone always forgets the ice.
B: I've been to enough NYC house parties to know the drill.
A: True. See you around 9 then?
B: I'll be there. I'll text you when I'm pulling up.
japanese: 任（まか）せて／言（い）わなくても分（わ）かってる
chinese: 懂了，不用多说 (Dǒng le, búyòng duōshuō) / 收到 (Shōudào)
spanish: No se diga más. / Entendido.

example:
A: You need to clean your room right now.
B: Why do I always have to do it? It's not even that messy.
A: Don't sass me, just get it done.
B: I'm just saying, it's unfair!
A: One more word and you're grounded.
B: Fine, I'm going.
japanese: 口答（くちごた）えしないで
chinese: 别跟我顶嘴 (Bié gēn wǒ dǐngzuǐ) / 别跟我耍嘴皮子 (Bié gēn wǒ shuǎ zuǐpízi)
spanish: No me contestes mal. / No me repliques.
